H0.text: Sunlight is the energy source that is nonrenewable.

H1.text: Biomass is the energy source that is nonrenewable.

H2.text: Wind is a nonrenewable energy source.

H3.text: Fossil fuel is the energy source that is nonrenewable.

A4.text: Although fossil fuels are continually formed by natural processes, they are classified as non-renewable resources because they take millions of years to form and known viable reserves are being depleted much faster than new ones are generated.

A5.text: The origin of fossil fuels is the anaerobic decomposition of buried dead organisms. The conversion from these organic materials to high-carbon fossil fuels is typically the result of a geological process of millions of years.
